website_summaries.verdict: This big and tall lift can handle the largest and widest cruisers.
pros: The OTC lift equips 17-inch skids for large and heavy bikes, and is rated for 1,500 pounds
Its lift range of 3.5-16.75 inches is wide, allowing for a variety of maintenance jobs to be done
Removable casters provide a full 360 degrees of access to your vehicle
Includes foot pedal release, automatic safety lock, and two ratcheting tie down straps
cons: The jack retracts at a very fast pace, which raises safety concerns

customer_reviews.title: Best Moto Lift on the market!
customer_reviews.text: You simply CANNOT go wrong with this lift!!!! Hands down the best bang for the buck. Back wheels lock...and two pins screw downward to eliminate movement even more. Smooth controls. SUPER easy to assemble!! Locking bar to prevent hydraulic leak/dump from inadvertently lowering your bike. You'd be a fool for buying anything even remotely comparable. Unless you're going for the full on shop lift in your garage...this is the way to go. Heavy duty and well built.
customer_reviews.author: durangoclimber

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: I was lucky, the bearings in one wheel were ready to come out. One of the handle screws was stripped-out prior to tightening. Welds are not great but shouldn't be an issue. The steel is adequate size and had no issue picking up a Harley Electra Glide (800 lbs). It maintained the bike upright for days. I have used it several times now and it seems to work fine, other then the handle I don't use. The price was good and so far I was one of the lucky ones.
customer_reviews.author: thesteelguy

customer_reviews.title: Used it twice now, confident in its capability
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my street glide to tear the entire bike down for a winter project. Did not experience the free fall others mentioned when lowering it. It was faster than I would like, but not scary. 5 stars as I avoided almost $700 unit others raved about. Assembly was minor and straight forward. Bike has been on the lift with the emergency stop bar engaged for 2 weeks while parts are out for powder coating. A little extra care needed with placement because I elected to leave my center stand on. Recommend disconnecting jiffy stand spring though to get it out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy blodgett

customer_reviews.title: Better than most
customer_reviews.text: Obviously sturdy construction. Lowers more than most lifts for ease of access under low-slung machines. Heavy castors and beams inspire confidence for use on my 900 lb.-plus Harley Road Glide. Only gave it 4 stars on stability as this type of lift is inherently a little wobbly - more so than a full-length garage lift. Just spend a couple minutes checking the best location points to lift the frame and no problem. Some have noted the jack lowers too quickly. I was able to snug-up the oil release screw on the jack and that slows the bleed-down. Very happy with this lift.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Yanney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect motorcycle lift
customer_reviews.text: Well I have to agree with several other reviews, if you have trouble putting this together, you probably should not be working on a motorcycle, REALLY SIMPLE! Was well packed, heavy duty carboard box and lots of cardboard inside keeping everything in place. I put it together, pumped it up to the highest spot, stood on it and hit the peddle to lower and it came down really nice and slow. Now keep in mind I don't weigh 850lbs like my Harley does but I do weigh 195 but will update this if the bike lowers really fast like others have said. Overall really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: He had no problems assembling it and is very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas for his Harley. He had no problems assembling it and is very happy with it. He does suggest that once it is assembled, raise it to its highest position and lower it several times BEFORE putting your bike on it. He didn't do that and his bike came down really hard the first time her lowered it. After that, he "exercised" it by raising a lowering a few times without the bike and when he put the bike back on, it did fine.
customer_reviews.author: KitKat1983

customer_reviews.title: Watch the safety catch, does not work properly.
customer_reviews.text: Lifts bike with ease. The safety catch doesn't work. Be careful when lowering the bike, one side of the safety catch caught on the stop the other did not. It twisted the jack slightly almost dropping my bike.
customer_reviews.author: david guiselman

customer_reviews.title: Initial review (before use)
customer_reviews.text: This lift seems very sturdy and easy to use. The one thing I didn't like is there are NO instructions. Sure there is a schematic of the parts layout and how things go together but instructions for ease of reading and tracing lines on the schematic would have been nice. Also, I found 2 pre-threaded bolt holes that are stripped out. Luckily they are not critical.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. I'm impressed how well it is built. I expect it to last a very long time. I also like how low it sits to slide right under my motorcycle frame. The only negative thing is that the rubber is not glued on straight.
customer_reviews.author: Xrider

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Came mostly assembled and the rest was easy to do. It hoisted my BMW up with ease; you just have to make sure it is centered under a point where both lift pads contact and lift evenly. Unless you do a little bit of modification to the foot pedal you may need to hold onto the bike when lowering as it can be a bit tricky controlling the rate of decent unless you are careful. It's built like a tank though and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Blayne Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Not a genuine product. Made in China with a otc sticker
customer_reviews.text: Lift works awsome.but as soon as it arrived I opened the box and ball bearings were scattered all over inside the box. Both rear casters fell apart. Unit was new and never used. These caster need to support a lot of weight so I'm unable to find metal low profile replacements I can trust.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Quality control not the best.
customer_reviews.text: The piston on the hydraulic pump would line up with the hole on the pulling frame and had to be sent back. Got a new one that was easy to assemble and works fine. The repacking and putting the old lift in the shipping box was not easy and I don't have banding straps so I had toe duct tape all around the box, which was somewhat tore up when it arrived. Returning unserviceable lift is not fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t go cheap on your Harley lift
customer_reviews.text: This lifts my fully loaded FLHTK limited and feels very solid while up in the air. I saw YouTube video where owner complained about lift dropping too fast when release valve is opened, not my experience, down valve works well, very controllable, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B

customer_reviews.title: Lift came apart on first use lifting 700# Fatboy
customer_reviews.text: This jack came apart under load on first use. The factory left 2 cotter pins off the jack arm pqins causing the pump pedal and seal shaft to blow out of the housing. Also, as others have complained the release lever drops the bike like a stone.
customer_reviews.author: Radiant Steel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Streetglide
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problems balancing, lifting or lowering my bike. It is as stable as you could expect it to be, I mean it isn't like it is anchored to the floor... This was a GREAT lift especially considering the price. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AZFLHX

customer_reviews.title: Love this jack
customer_reviews.text: Love this jack. One problem as other people have noted is how fast it lets down. I found if i put my heal on the jack and toe on the pedal and barely press I can control it pretty well. Some people put a bolt through the pedal and adjusted it to the breaking point so they couldn't push it down too far or too quick.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in great shape with no damage. Went together easily - pretty much common sense. Worked great to do 3 hole fluid change on my 2016 HD Street Glide. Lowering wasn’t a problem or too fast. Great product - very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I really like how low the bars go so it slides under every motorcycle I have.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over cheaper versions as I appreciate how easy this slides under all brands of motorcycles. Construction is hefty, and solid even if a little rough in spots. Works as it should. Nice long riser bars as well.
customer_reviews.author: son of the hounds

customer_reviews.title: I would have given the lift a 5 star except.
customer_reviews.text: The locking bar doesn't fit the locking tabs right. The bar is to narrow. If you look at the close up picture you will see a crescent wrench between the frame of the lift and the locking bar. There's another crescent wrench on the other side. With out the wrenches in there, one side or the other of the locking bar would move to the inside and wedge itself between the tad and the frame. Other wise it feel Sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L Norris

customer_reviews.title: This lift is low profile!!
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't review products from Amazon but I felt I needed to share my thoughts on this lift. I would say the most important thing for me was that it slid easily under my 2016 Road Glide Special so I didn't have to stand the bike up like I did for another lift to slide under. This lift does this with plenty of clearance. Packaging was great. It was put together in no time. I've only lifted my bike a couple of times but so far so good. Time will tell but this seems like a great lift at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: capozp

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I contemplated buying something a bit cheaper, but very glad I went with this model. Already lifted both bikes and changed the oil this past weekend. No stability problems at all and fit nicely under a Yamaha V Star and Harley Fatboy. Didn't even need to use the straps...against the wishes of my wife:-) To respond to a couple negative reviews about the assembly, I'd have to say that if you had trouble putting this thing together, you probably should not be working on your own bike. It was literally like 5 pieces and they could only fit in very specific places by some bolts. Took less than 10 minutes to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: jmk

customer_reviews.title: Need this type of lift? Get it.
customer_reviews.text: Received on time and as described. I've only used it one time in the short time that I have had it. It works just fine. It will take you a little time to assemble but nothing too difficult. Instructions were adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Arrived Promptly
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Got it for my husband for Christmas so he could lift the heavier motorcycles he works on and not have to worry about the weight or strain his back so much. This lift is extremely heavy so I needed a little help from a neighbor moving and hiding it, but it was easy to assemble and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Paige Porchia

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME LIFT!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this lift!!! No other lift was low enough to get under my lowered Softail or my wife's Nightster except this one, I don't have to hold the bike up with one hand while pushing the lift under with the other, I can slide the lift under the bike while it's still leaned over on the kickstand. AND IT DOES NOT LEAK AT ALL!!! The Softail has been up for a year now under going a major restoration and has not moved one bit compared to cheaper lifts that leak down over night. So now I'm going to order a second one to tear the Nightster down this winter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hagstrom

customer_reviews.title: Super low profile.
customer_reviews.text: This lift is the lowest I have come across and easily fits under any bike I have worked on. The quality of the lift and hydraulic cylinder is top rate. Made in USA. I have only good things to say about this lift. I would recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang for the buck at this point
customer_reviews.text: Way above Harbor freight junk. The design is well thought out . I am only giving 4 stars for now because Chines hydraulics are questionable at best but so far so good. Biggest complaint I read was " NO ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS" If you cant figure out how to put this together, you have now business jacking up a bike in the first place , Stay tuned
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good solid easy to use lift.
customer_reviews.text: This lift is fantastic. I use it to hoist up my VTX1300R and I just slide it under and pump the foot peddle and it just lifts up smooth off the kickstand. Stable while lifted and rolls pretty well with the bike lifted. It tends to bounce a little when lowering but not a big deal, it lowers slowly and places the bike nicely back on the kickstand with no effort. The safety lock works pretty well, I tested it by setting the lock and hitting the release peddle and it grabbed and stopped the bike from lowering. I love it, its a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: ilmod

customer_reviews.title: I love my OTC Lift!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used it a couple times since purchase on ATV's and am very well pleased with it. Very well built (heavy!!!) and I am sure it will last me a life time. Some assembly required, but piece of cake. I had looked at a lot of online reviews for this product and some had made mention of a problem with this lift having a sudden drastic drop with the lift release (with lowering the lift)....the company must have fixed this issue, as mine lowers normally as it should with no issues, just like you would expect with a regular hydraulic jack.
customer_reviews.author: daSavage

customer_reviews.title: Confidence to lift my 900# harley
customer_reviews.text: This being my third M/C lift of this type. It is the best. Ease of operation Strength Quality of construction I like it.
customer_reviews.author: bart5495

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a custom Victory Jacpot, that I had lowered and forked out to 45 degees, so the bike sits low, and this jack lift fits perfectly right underneath it. I thought I might have to use a car ramp to raise it up, but nope, I did not. It claims to be the lowest lift out there and I believe it. It came right on time, so I was happy with that. No instructions on how to assemble, but the exploded view of all the parts pretty much show you where everything goes. Common sense would of work on it's own. Very sturdy holding up this heavy bike. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Crownman

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the jack lowering too fast as my last one almost a dead drop. This one lowered my Road King smooth and slow. Very sturdy as well. My HF jack worked but it was somewhat unstable and dropped fast. Now the jack arrived without fluid due the rubber seal coming out. They are sending me some oil but I put in Blackjack Hydraulic oil from Walmart since I needed to use the jack. I have no idea if this oil is the same or heavier as stock oil.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: OTC 1545 Retracts way too quickly
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is one that other have share as well. It retracts (comes down) way too quickly. It is practically a sudden drop, no matter how lightly to press the release pedal. If one presses the release pedal lightly, it shakes like crazy. This is no good when your motorcycle is on it. I just got off the phone with OTC Tools. They informed me all the OTC 1545 models do this. There is no adjustment mechanism to change the speed of the descent. I would suggest no one buy this lift for motorcycle use.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: i have a 2008 super glide custome...frame work dosent fit the flat riseers on the lift...
customer_reviews.text: do you have a kit to fit a 2008 super glide custom? when i bought it said it fit ....but its the enternet...help?...im not dropping my 10k bike
customer_reviews.author: Mike A.

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like about this is that
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about this is that, as others have said, when you go to release the lift to lower the bike...be VERY VERY careful because it drops like a rock...you can manage it by being VERY careful....but if you push the release pedal thinking you are going to be getting a slow release of pressure and the bike slowly descending...you are in for a very unpleasant surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Smith

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle lift.
customer_reviews.text: Tried a sears and it wouldn't fit under the bike. This one seems sturdier. It fits under my bike with only one issue. The bar across the front of the jack hits the kickstand so I can't push the jack as far forward as I'd like. The other issue is the release peddle is overly sensitive. It's very difficult - almost impossible - to lower the bike slowly so when you do lower it and you take your foot off the release peddle the bike bounces a bit. It does seem to be well built and sturdy. I also didn't have $400 to spend on a premium jack.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pergament

customer_reviews.title: best made highest quality lift
customer_reviews.text: this the!! best made highest quality lift, ever I have a custom built softail with a ridiculous amount of chrome had to have a lift. super easy assembly and quality? exceeds my expectations this a solid built heavy construction. lift its not ligt its quite heavy but with the easy glide casters its a dream im so impressed im ordering a second one for my bike in florida 5 thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: lindsey gear

customer_reviews.title: Might require "tweaks" but works well
customer_reviews.text: Overall lifts a Heritage Softail with no problems. The safety straps were too long for my use, so I trimmed them slightly. Make sure you have the bike in its maximum top position to avoid cutting them too short. The safety locks have a significant amount of play. I had to adjust (read bend) them back into shape to solidly lock in both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ease of lifting and sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: Great motorcycle lift. Lifts my 700 lb Yamaha easy . Easy to assemble, can move motorcycle when on lift . Well built and would highly recommend..
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Best Jack / Lift for the Money !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second MC Lift I've owned... First one cost me $70.00 , bought it through a tool liquidator , It was junk right out of the package... The OTC Lift is built like a tank... Low enough to get under any bike... Safety lock mechanism , robust construction and cylinder... Letting the unit down can be tricky , I have a hard time feathering the release... It works fine , Just seems to me that the bike comes down FAST... Overall , I am extremely pleased with the purchase , and would recommend to a friend or colleague...
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone Malone

customer_reviews.title: What a crap deal this was.
customer_reviews.text: I unboxed the package which was already is poor shape just by looking at it. One of the casters is straight up broken and pieces all over in the box. Missing pieces and the hooks on the front of the jack for tie downs are bent. This thing is unusable until I get a caster ordered. Very unhappy with this purchase. I am not one to ever write reviews but this was very poor. Scared to even use it once it’s fixed to be honest now.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: The box had quite a few ball bearings rolling around in it, I hope they weren't important. There were Zero assembly instructions.I was able to figure it out and had it together in about 20 minutes. It lifted my 2010 FLHX Street Glide with no problem. I purchased this model because it had the widest distance between the pads that I could find. It comes with 2 straps that are about 6ft longer than needed, but appear to be of good quality. Once the bike was strapped down, it seemed very solid and I was able to move the bike around the garage with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jarhead8596

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: Great lift. A lot more heavy duty that the cheap Harbor Freight. Also has tie down loops and straps.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Crovo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lift!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in good condition, box is heavy so The box got a little damage. The lift is sturdy and will lift a very large bike like my Harley Davidson Electra Glide. The material used is strong, my only thought is how fast the lift lowers, but not anything concerning. All in all, this is a great lift for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the straps
customer_reviews.text: Firstly this was very easy to assemble and a breeze to use. Not sure how people are stripping anything with the handle, there's no reason you should be pushing a motorcycle around by that handle, you should lift it, strap it, and the push by the bike itself. Now be careful with the straps though! The straps anchor to the base of the jack, so if you strap down the bike tightly and later decide to lift the bike some more, you will be putting a ton of force on those straps and could break them or something on your motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Fry

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, except now you only get 2 ratchet straps and NO DIRECTIONS!!!! You don't really need directions but it would be nice to have some. As others have said, when you lower the jack the valve is wide open, so be prepared. It would be nice to have a regulator valve on the hydraulic jack. Other than that a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: donutz

customer_reviews.title: Great jack for price
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my 2005 ultra classic so much better than Harbor freight 100 dollar jack for just a bit more was pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.author: Darrin

customer_reviews.title: Works well after I repaired it.
customer_reviews.text: This jack works fine but I had to do repairs. First it came with the roller bearings falling out of one side. Then the attaching holes that you bolt the handle to were stripped and I had to install a couple of self tapping bolts. Trying to get replacement parts or even schedule a return or exchange has be problematic. I seems impossible to contact Amazon and the website won't let me choose a reason for return and of course you can't move the process along without choosing a reason....the classic circular arguement.
customer_reviews.author: David Tubbs

customer_reviews.title: nice lift
customer_reviews.text: I picked one of these up from amazon as used "like new,damaged box " for $135.00. Compared to some of the others I had looked this one seemed better. It lacks assembly instructions but has an exploded drawing, if you can't figure it out and have it finished in about 15min then you should probably not be working on your bike. The skids on it are about 17" which is about 6" longer than most of the cheap ones out there. I almost bought one from Harbor Freight, I am glad I didn't, this is a far better product.
customer_reviews.author: Kraig McCluskey

customer_reviews.title: A questionable purchase
customer_reviews.text: Not too impressed with this lifts design and the fact that it was delivered missing a couple of washers and the bolts on the swing arm that secure it to the lift came off along with the arm while I was moving it around. (luckily without my bike on the stand). Fixed it with the appropriate sized bolts & the washers that it was missing that I purchased at my local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Randy V.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you will like it.
customer_reviews.text: This lift works great. I feel very confident when I work under my Harley Dyna. The bike is well balanced on the lift. I also purchase from the Harley Dealer the Kit for jacking up the Harley which amounts to spacer that attach to the frame rails under the bike and provide a level surface to place the jack under. This won't work for Honda Goldwings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very solid jack
customer_reviews.text: I did purchase this jack even after reading the reviews. Yes there were some miner repairs that needed to be made where the cylinder pins into the lift mechanism. I was able to make the repairs myself. The assembly was fairly simple. When using the jack for the first time I was cautious but it is the best jack I have used. I have a Harley Springer Softail and it rolls right under it with lots of clearance.
customer_reviews.author: Dwane R. Fehr

customer_reviews.title: Ok jack
customer_reviews.text: Good jack. Stripped out bolt holes for the handle. So no handle for me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice lift
customer_reviews.text: This lift has a very low profile it will slide under a bike frame with only three inches clearance. Very easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie spaghetti.

customer_reviews.title: So far works great. Assembly was easy and it lifted the bike ...
customer_reviews.text: So far works great. Assembly was easy and it lifted the bike up great. Felt sturdy, but not sure I'd move the bike around with it on there
customer_reviews.author: Thijs

customer_reviews.title: Best lift yet.....
customer_reviews.text: Best lift I've found for my lowered Harley Davidson Ultra Classic (FLHTCU). This lift is lower than any others I have seen. I can slide the lift under the bike even on the side stand. It makes working on and washing the Harley a much easier task. No problems, assembly was easy. (just a few pieces to put together)
customer_reviews.author: OFP

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my HD Ultra classic
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my HD Ultra classic. You just have to be careful when lowering it comes down fast. Oct 20 2016 had this jack for a few years now only used it maybe 10 times, now the hydraulic jack will not jack up. I have researched but have not found how to repair jack as of tonight. it is not your typical hyd. jack. still searching.
customer_reviews.author: L.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Lift
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for a few months and the lift is excellent. I use it to store my bike in the garage upright...takes less room.
customer_reviews.author: GoBucks

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this motorcycle lift!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this motorcycle lift! I borrowed a Sears motorcycle lift from a friend and it did not work on my 2001 Goldwing, was awful (and I almost purchased one). However, this lift works perfectly on my Wing. I highly recommend this item, especially if you have a bike that sits low to the ground because this lift gets down to just two-three inches off the ground. AWESOME! Also, well made. As usual, always good luck when I purchase from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: works well but does have a touchy release to lower the bike.
customer_reviews.text: I have to pace 3/4" board along the frame because the motor hangs lower than the frame by about 1/2". other than that it works well. I was forwarned by another review that the release for lowering was touchy and it is. You need to "feather" it down very gently but it is not hard to do.
customer_reviews.author: Ricci Weatherman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT JACK FOR  LIFTING LARGE MOTORCYCLES
customer_reviews.text: AFTER READING ALL THE REVIEWS, MANY WERE NEGATIVE, BUT I ORDERED THE OTC JACK ANYWAY.. I EXPECTED IT TO ARRIVE IN PIECES, BUT MY ARRIVED WITH THE CARTON IN GREAT SHAPE. THERE WERE NO DIRECTIONS, BUT IT WENT TOGETHER VERY EASY. I LIFTED MY NEW ULTA CLASSIC LIMITED WITH EASE, HAD NO PROBLEM LOWERING THE MOTORCYCLE.IT ALSO HAS A BUILT IN SAFETY LOCK, SO IF THE JACK FAILS IT WON'T FALL. I FEEL FOR THE MONEY IT IS WELL BUILT AND WORKS JUST FIND. I WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO MY FRIENDS.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Good Clearance
customer_reviews.text: I use it on a 2007 softail (harley Davidsaon). It fits just right under the frame. The handle where it attaches to the jack is weak. WHEN LETTING YHE JACK DOWN IT SEEMS A LITTLE ABRUPT. BUT IT WORKS GREAT. Ive used it only a few times its too dangerous with the way it drops the bike down. Really can't recommend it. OTC should send out replacement pumps to swap out
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: customer service
customer_reviews.text: Assembled unit but hydraulic jack would not release. Contacted customer service and had replacement hydraulic unit in three days. Jack is currently holding bike and working well. HD Breakout 114
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

customer_reviews.title: This is going to be a great lift! Glad I didn't buy one of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be a great lift! Glad I didn't buy one of the cheaper/inexpensive models. For $200+ this is one heavy-duty motorcycle lift. Has a locking feature on it that you can 'lock' the height so it will not fall lower. Comes with nice straps and rolls easily. OK, here is why it's not 5-stars: NO DIRECTIONS! Came with only the parts lists and exploded diagram. Not hard to figure out; minimal assembly, but has to be done in order. Put the pump assembly (Part 11) on last, makes it easier. Lift up on the bracket assembly (Part 33) to make it easier to attach some of the pieces. Need a 14mm wrench for all the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Texasgrape

customer_reviews.title: Great product......for price
customer_reviews.text: Product is what was expected....we live it for our HD .....could have done a better job with shipping as the package came off the truck looking like it just left a war zone .....other then that no complaints ....good product for price:)
customer_reviews.author: J. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: solidly built
customer_reviews.text: a little difficult to assemble as one of the bolts could not easily go through misaligned frame parts.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Bordan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike Lift
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, bike has been up for over 3 weeks waiting for my parts to return and it hasn't moved at all. It was easy to setup, took less than 15 minutes before I was lifting the bike ('02 Harley Sportster 1200). Packaging for shipment should be a bit more robust, box was damaged on arrival but luckily all parts were still enclosed and nothing inside was damaged (it's a solid piece of equipment so it would take allot to damage the parts). Other than packaging, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: TommyLI

customer_reviews.title: Not for sports bikes
customer_reviews.text: Although this was advertised as a lift for sports bikes as well, I never found where this would work correctly without crushing my fairings on the bottom. This may be ideal for a cruiser type bike, but DO NOT believe the information for sports bikes.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dunson

customer_reviews.title: A great lift.
customer_reviews.text: I have a ARGO 8 wheel drive AATV, and I needed a lift that dropped down to a least 4" and could lift at least 1100 LBS, as well as be wide enough to lift the front or rear end of my AATV (10 FT long) without tipping to one side or the other. This lift did the job with ease. And no shipping charge for a 90 LB tool....That's great!
customer_reviews.author: Trapshooter

customer_reviews.title: Does the job on my Harley - had to make ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job on my Harley - had to make a couple of wooden pieces to raise it above the shocks on the underside of my Heritage Softtail Classic so I could get at the oil drain plug. Comes down a little fast, takes some getting used to . . .
customer_reviews.author: EZRider99

customer_reviews.title: Very nice value.
customer_reviews.text: There are better motorcycle lifts on the market. They are lighter or more maneuverable. But, they are really expensive. The OTC has always lifted the bike, has never dropped the bike, and is stable with the bike lifted. A major feature is that it is very low, and can get under bikes with little clearance.
customer_reviews.author: jst1man

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle Lift
customer_reviews.text: Incredible motorcycle lift for the price. The manufacturing quality is great and with all the attention to detail, you cannot go wrong! The attraction for me initially was the price but when I received the lift, I could not believe the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Yukoneddie

customer_reviews.title: Suzuki M50 up on it
customer_reviews.text: No directions but the parts diagram was easy to follow. If you are going to do some work on your machine, then you have to have some basic mechanical skills to put this together. Agree with others, the lift is very sensitive on the way down.... like 2 lbs of pressure is plenty, that's like stepping on your own foot with no pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have item. With this i am able to detail my bike (2007 VTX 1300)in half the time. Saves the back and is easy to use. You do have to put it together but its pretty easy. There is a manual with a blow out for parts and part numbers comes in English French and Spanish. Made in China. Is well built. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Very stable
customer_reviews.text: This jack lifts my Yamaha Roadliner like it isn't even there. It's really stable on the jack and it came with a couple of straps to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Harold M.

customer_reviews.title: Good lift for the money..Great product
customer_reviews.text: The pros: Affordable, strongly made, free shipping++! one man operation. Arrived quickly. The cons: Package was abused during long shipment, a plus was all the pieces were intact.I had to free the lift jack cylinder by bleeding the pressure off the jack lift cylinder due to some saltwater corrosion from shipping. To truly obtain a 3-4" clearance, I will have to re-weld the two strap points where they are now parallel with the lower box tubing frame, not welded above the top of the tubing, as it was manufactured. If your bike has an extended kickstand, it is inconvenient to align on that side.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Mike's android

customer_reviews.title: OTC 1545 Motorcycle Lift
customer_reviews.text: I have a loaded Honda Valk. This stand works great. Safe. Secure. Lifts easily. The unit is heavy, but comes with good rolling wheels and strong handle to move it. The wheels can be locked. I have used this a dozen times now. Makes oil change and cleaning a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: bikerjack

customer_reviews.title: Lifts my Harley Road King fine, but it's scary coming down!
customer_reviews.text: Going down the jack bounces the bike and drops it like a stone. No, it's not safe. I modified the jack so it's safer to operate. I show how to modify the jack on youtube. Look up 007connecticuct on youtube, search for OTC jack repair.....
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: BAD design, flawed lift
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to lower my motorcycle using this lift, it dropped so FAST, and HARD that my motorcycle almost fell off the jack!!! OTC is aware of the problem, but currently they do NOT have a fix for it!! They pretty much said deal with it, that's just the way it goes! I'm ready to throw this lift in the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: wildthang

customer_reviews.title: Very satisified
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, easy to assemble, works great. Includes a safety feature that holds the lift in the open position even if the hydraulic cylinder valve leaks. Very poor packaging. Regular cardboard box for heavy steel parts. Mine was delivered in peices by the ups driver but everything was there.
customer_reviews.author: Ridgeland MS

customer_reviews.title: “Refurbished” missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Supplier left out a fairly crucial piece of the rear wheel. Otherwise good product
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Handy lift
customer_reviews.text: We bought this lift for our cruiser and it was money well spent. It's nice to be able to work on our bike and stores away nicely although it is heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Porter

customer_reviews.title: Stinger Motorcycle Lift
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value for the money. The unit works well for my 2011 Harley Ultra Limited. Performs as advertised. It does not roll about as easily as I would have liked when my bike is on the lift. It does not always collapse all the way down as it should but these are minor inconveniences for me. Otherwise this lift really does the job.
customer_reviews.author: PawPaw Bear

customer_reviews.title: OTC Motorcycle Jack
customer_reviews.text: I received this from Amazon after a lengthy delay in shipping. The jack itself was intact, although the outer carton was essentially destroyed. The jack is decent, well made and rather heavy, as it should be. It is not as stable as I hoped it would be to hold my 750# Harley. It tends to rock front to back even if balanced properly. My only suggestion is that you make sure you are on absolutely level ground and don't raise the bike higher than 12 inches off the ground to assure that it will be stable.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Works ALOT better than it looks
customer_reviews.text: Jack comes unassembled with no assembly instructions but does have an exploded view drawing. The paint on some of my components (primarily the jack)was terrible.It looked like melted crayon and was chipped badly showing the red paint underneath and covered with grease. The straps are great once the bike is in the air especially if swapping tires or shocks. Now the lift. It WORKS perfectly. The lock at different heights is dependable and defies it's delicate appearance! Operation is smooth and the jack does not leak. I am VERY impressed with the operation of this lift. It handles not only my lowered FXSTD but also my buddies Ultra as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done! Could be a little more steady But not dangerously so
customer_reviews.author: Kenny K

customer_reviews.title: Longer skids and lower clearance
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than the cheaper one I had from Harbor Freight. Longer skids and lower clearance allow it to lift my Yamaha 1300 right off the kick stand without much trouble..
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: bought to use with my new harley breakout (big, and heavy bike)... works flawlessly. i can place the lift, hold the bars, and operate it with my foot for completely one person use!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Parker

customer_reviews.title: handle bolts stripped out
customer_reviews.text: 2 bolt stripped out to start? i will fix and get back to you...
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The item was received in a timely manner. For the most part it is made of quality steel and very easy to assemble. It took me about 15 minutes to put together. The one fault with the product was the two bolts that hold the handle bracket had very poor threads and just backed out of the holes. I went to a local hardware store purchased two more bolts with better thread, and everything is now perfect. I have already used this twice and it is very convenient and easy to use. I highly recommend this product and the company I purchased it from.
customer_reviews.author: J. Razza

customer_reviews.title: It's like having your own motorcycle shop in the garage
customer_reviews.text: I find it really handy to have a hydraulic lift big enough for my Road King, but also very handy for working on my smaller off-road bike too. The directions for putting it together could be a bit better, but it wasn't too hard to figure out, and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ethosian

customer_reviews.title: Great lift for the price
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I didn’t buy one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mstornant

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This lift is very stable and heavy duty. It was fairly easy to put together and holds my Harley perfectly. Great for working on my bike or weekend polishes.
customer_reviews.author: 1HonestMan

customer_reviews.title: very good lift
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy unit. It holds my Road King up and appears very stable. am happy with this purchase and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdog

customer_reviews.title: Lift works great
customer_reviews.text: Lift works great. Takes my 750 pound 1600 Roadstar up very easily. Left it up for days and it didn't drop a bit. Make sure you pull back the safety bar and lock it in the wire clip when lowering the bike or it will stop on the way down. There are no instructions on putting it together but it's pretty easy to figure out where the few parts go that you have to assemble by looking at the exploded diagram provided. About 15 minutes or less to put the parts in place.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Quality control-none here
customer_reviews.text: The jack came very soon after the order, so far no problem. Went to assemble it, it was very easy to put together, till I got to the bottle jack, the release plunger wouldn't work so it went up not down, so after thinking if I will send it to a service center 50 miles away, I looked it over, I had to remove the plunger and related parts, found it all full of crud after cleaning and re-oiling and a few hours later it worked ok. Not the best construction crude but it will work ok I'm sure. Buy American its better.
customer_reviews.author: Jackman

customer_reviews.title: lift sucks should cost $89.99
customer_reviews.text: no better than sears big red lift , just cost more, i'lltry to sell and get a black widow this wiggles even cleaning rims if I do any work jack stands will also be used the weight of a M109 make it sag and the locking mech sticks and will not drop in place while lifting poor buy
customer_reviews.author: maj

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lift. Works great. Easy to work on bike and very stable. Ya got to get one!!
customer_reviews.author: Randall S.

customer_reviews.title: Works with a little extra effort
customer_reviews.text: The bolts for the handle were stripped from the get. I am going to have someone weld it for me but all an all the lift is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Smith

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for thanks fits underneath my Harley-Davidson Ultra
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: After going to my local Sears and getting a lift that didn't work and returning it. I figured I'd try this one out, and it was exactly what i wanted. I have a 1996 Sportster XL 1200 Custom and this baby sits really low. The lift from Sears couldn't go low enough but the Stinger slid right under there, and held my bike solidly in the up position while I worked on it. I am totally satisfied with this purchase and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

product_meta.title: OTC 1545 Ultra Low Profile Motorcycle and ATV Lift with 1,500 lb. Capacity
product_meta.description: OTC's Motorcycle/ATV Lift has a 1,500 pound capacity and 17 inch long skids that will lift the largest and widest cruisers on the road. With the lowest clearance available - 3-1/2 inches at it's lowest level - with a wide lifting range of 3-1/2 inches to 16-3/4 inches, this versatile jack is perfect for occasional use in your home garage or for the heavy user at a busy shop. Removable handle provides 360 degree access to load and T-handle design makes maneuvering the jack easier. Great features include: foot pedal release, locking rear casters, automatic safety lock, and two ratcheting tie down straps for safety when the jack is in use. Two-year limited warranty. Value is at the core of the OTC tool and equipment portfolio. Whether it’s a simple repair or the most complex drivability concern, these award-winning tools universally solve problems faster, and at better value, than any other product line available. Whether it’s a specialty tool or unique piece of service equipment, OTC provides top solutions to modern automotive service challenges while increasing technicians’ productivity and shop profits.
feature_bullets: OTC's Motorcycle/ATV Lift has a 1,500 pound capacity and 17 inch long skids that will lift the largest and widest cruisers on the road
Lowest clearance available - 3-1/2 inch at lowest level - with a wide lifting range of 3-1/2 inches to 16-3/4 inches
Removable handle provides 360 degree access to load; T-handle design makes maneuvering the jack easier
Great features include: foot pedal release, locking rear casters, automatic safety lock, and two ratcheting tie down straps for safety when the jack is in use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars351 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
